comment: 4 map quizzes, 2 big test (midterm and final) which are essays but goes over the topics in depth to help. Talks monotone but I pass this class.

3 quizzes, midterm + final are 2 in class essays each supposed to be about 2 pages. Doesn't talk to the class, just lectures reading pretty much from the powerpoint. Book not really needed. Goes over essay topics in depth in class, and if you know basic geography the map quizzes are cake. Would not retake this teacher, brain was mush from boredom.

Horrible class if you ever want to learn. This prof might want to consider another line of work because teaching obviously isn't his thing. He is unable to connect the material in a way that makes it stick. He is boring beyond belief and as a result people just sleep through his class or leave after they sign the attendance.
Possible the most boring class I've ever had in college. With history it really is all about the teacher. Do yourself a favor and take somebody that will make it interesting instead of painful.

This class will be the easiest class you will EVER take in college, but it is ridiculously boring. Grades are based off of 4 map quizzes worth 5 pts each and 4 essays (2 final and 2 midterm). Every class you come in and listen to a short 20 minute lecture and then watch a video. Most of the information is useless and will not be brought up again.

This professory was awesome. Hes really chill. Pretty much every class you'll take a little bit of notes then watch a video. He's very consistent and wants you to do well. His grades consist of 2 in class essays (midterm and final) and several map quizzes. He will fully prepare you for the essays and review for them several classes. TAKE HIS CLASS!
The most boring teacher I've ever had. If you ever want to learn something about history, you'd better take somebody else.
Lots of interesting videos. Four map quizzes and short essay based tests. Good class because it covers every region of the world.
Lots of interesting videos. Four map quizzes and short essay based tests. Good class because it covers every region of the world.

Run, run, run away from this guy as fast as you can! There are only 2 essay tests in this class and he doesn't explain things well. A few map quizzes worth 5 points don't help much. I hated every minute of this class. Attendance mandatory, but many people sign in and leave because he is just too boring.
Pretty easy class. Make sure you remember the places on the map that will be on the map quizzes. Goes over review for midterm and final. Very helpful professor.
he is a nice teacher, and although grades are based off of 5 map quizzes and 4 essay questions (broken up into two each for midterm and final), the class is relatively easy.

Good class! Covers world history in one semester, so it's a brief overview rather than any in-depth of any region/country/civilization. Shows interesting videos and really prepares the class with helpful review guides on midterm and map quizzes. Professor is very helpful if you talk to him.
Good class! Pretty easy if you do the reading and pay attention in class.PowerPoint slides are on WebCt. They are good summaries of each chapter. Professor is very nice and helpful.
Class goes pretty fast with one chapter per class but professor is really nice and helpful! Tries to answer your questions and helps you prepare for midterm and map quizzes. Cool guy!
Interesting class. Covers lots of topics and interesting places. Nice videos for visualization.
Great class! Lots of good PowerPoint and videos. Explains very clearly with good review study guides for midterm and map quizzes.

Has never taught before and it shows. Has no clue what is in the book. Doesn't actually teach, just reads bullet points off Power Point and shows movies. Will not answer questions. Only 2 tests whole semester-with 2 essay questions each.If you value your GPA or actually want to learn,take someone else. I withdrew rather than suffer further.
